definition[0]: used to check that someone is willing to do something or let you do something
example[0]: If you don’t mind, I think I’ll go to bed now.
example[1]: I’d like to stay a while longer, if you don’t mind.
example[2]: We’ll go there together – that’s if you don’t mind.
definition[1]: used when you are annoyed to tell someone what to do or what you are going to do
example[3]: Now, if you don’t mind, I’d like to get back to bed.
definition[2]: used humorously or rudely to correct something someone has said
example[4]: The name’s John, not Jonathan, if you don’t mind.
definition[3]: used to refuse someone’s offer politely
example[5]: ‘Do you want to come for a drink?’ ‘I won’t, if you don’t mind. I’ve got a lot of work to do.’
